page.title: 06Housing in Ferryhill
page.content: {1.Private}There are large houses around the market area which are the oldest in the town dating back some 200 years.There are also housing estates in the Cleves Cross area of Ferryhill built since 1960-new houses are at present being built in this area. {2.Terraced}The houses in the Dean Bank and Ferryhill Station areas were built as miner's homes and originally rented from the colliery.Many are now owner occupied although some are still rented from council or housing society. {3.Council}Council houses were built in the Broom and Stobbs Cross areas after 1940.Some are now owner occupied but the majority are still rented from Sedgefield District Council .
